page.title: 16Schooling in Breamore
page.content: Breamore primary school,a{Victorian } structure opened in 1872,serves the needs of the villages of Breamore, Woodgreen,and Godshill.Presently,56 children are enrolled,with numbers rising as parents from Fordingbridge and Whitsbury choose to send their children there. Some 95% of Breamore school children then attend the{Burgate Comprehensive, the nearest 11-16 secondary school. Occasionally,a pupil may choose to attend a single-sex grammar school in Salisbury,where the old"grammar- secondary modern system" is still operating.A controversial decision has just been made(Sept.1985)to scrap this system in favour of a comprehensive one and if it obtains the approval of SIr Keith Joseph,the present Education Secretary,this schooling option will no longer be available.
